# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in B (Shape: A)

## Introduction:
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is a type of arpeggio that includes the root note, major third, augmented fifth, and minor seventh. In the key of B, this arpeggio is played with the shape starting from an A shape. This arpeggio adds tension and color to your playing, making it a versatile tool in improvisation and composition.

## Notes and Intervals:
- Root (B)
- Major Third (D#)
- Augmented Fifth (F##)
- Minor Seventh (A)
  
## Musical Flavor and Genre:
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio has a bit of a jazz flavor due to its augmented fifth and minor seventh intervals. It adds a sense of tension and dissonance, making it suitable for genres like jazz fusion, progressive rock, and even some metal styles. This arpeggio can bring a sense of unpredictability and excitement to your music.
